comment: I had Jim at Illinois State University long before Y2K meant anything.  He has tough guidelines as far as accountability for assignments and class attendance, but I find them reasonable now compare to work deadlines and such. Participation matters in this class. Progress only develops with practice and critical observation of our work and others.

I took Creative Writing with him when he taught at Illinois State University. He would tear apart my work but didn't give guidance. He made you feel like you were a terrible writer but didn't show you how to get better. He counted tardies like absences and graded harshly on them. I learned nothing from him except how to be a bad professor.

I dropped his class after the first day. His attendance policy is that he drops a letter grade for every absence. No excuses. If there is a death he will consider excusing the absence. He seemed pretty ridiculous to me. He also seemed to have A TON of assignments due each week. I wouldn't take him again.
study abroad with this professor! He is wonderful and very helpful! Will work with you to help you reach your writing goal. Just be on time and prepared for class.
